review: Fire stick plugs directly into TV, and uses it's speaker system. If you have an older receiver that links to speakers, and it doesn't have an HDMI input, you can't get sound to work.  Bummer...So I went and tried this on a TV that has issues with picking up WiFi with an existing Smart DVD player. Fire TV stick still couldn't solve that issue, although a Roku 2 box could. So at the end of the day, I'm not impressed.
author: Michael K.

review: Ordered this Fire Stick Dec 1st; It has been working fine till now.The audio has just died; I have restarted this thing twice, checked all settings and connections, but I get NO audio anymore. (Correction: The cute little guy that pops up and talks about the Firs Stick works fine.) The videos, NOTHING!  The unit is plugged into a HDMI switcher; audio output comes from the switcher directly into the audio amp. The fact that the promo audio works tells me that the connections are all good.This should not have a 4-month life cycle. Or maybe an Amazon update just 'bricked' the audio. Can I get a replacement from Amazon? What's the warranty period on the Fire Stick???Disappointed to say the least.
